title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Microsoft's LinkedIn said that it would shut the version of its professional-networking site that operates in China.

Activist investor Jana has taken a stake in Macy's and is urging the retailer to spin off its fast-growing e-commerce business.

U.S. stocks rallied, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq both climbing 1.7% and the Dow notching a 1.6% gain.

BofA said its third-quarter profit climbed 58%, suggesting banks' lending businesses are starting to improve from a pandemic slump.

Morgan Stanley reported a 36% increase in profit for the latest quarter.

Citigroup's profit rose 48% in the third quarter.

Deere workers went on strike, extending a series of labor disputes at major U.S. companies during a nationwide labor shortage.

Walgreens will pay $5.2 billion to acquire a controlling stake in primary-care network VillageMD.

J&J placed into bankruptcy its liabilities for tens of thousands of claims linking talc-based products to cancer.

What's News: Business & Finance
